title: Need advice learning principles of Swiss typography
content: Hi im a graphic design student. i have always been impressed with Swiss typopgraphy, does anyone know any resources or books that actually teach you how to get such good compositions and typographic layouts? i really want to learn, as I always strive for elegance in design, and i never really know where things "go" as such.
author: newbie_chez

comments.content: [start with] - two major schools - about the Swiss design philosophy - one in Basel, the other in Zurich. Armin Hofmann typifies the former's approach, Josef Muller-Brockmann the latter's. and of course - Wolfgang Weingart (Basel) !!!

Cheryl,   
   
You may need to pawn a limb to afford these. Just be sure it's not your drawing arm!   
   
 [The Typographic Grid](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013050627/http:/youworkforthem.com/product.php?sku=P0006), Hans Rudolf Bosshard   
   
 [Grid Systems in Graphic Design](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013050627/http:/youworkforthem.com/product.php?sku=P0004), Josef Müller-Brockmann   
   
 [Typographie](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013050627/http:/youworkforthem.com/product.php?sku=P0005), Emil Ruder   
   
 [My Way to Typography](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013050627/http:/youworkforthem.com/product.php?sku=P0051), Wolfgang Weingart   
   
 [Graphic Design Manual: Principles and Practice](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013050627/http:/youworkforthem.com/product.php?sku=P0009), Armin Hofmann   
   
 -t

some of the books were at the library in uni.   
   
thanks so much for the help.   
yes, some of them are VERY expensive for my budget!
